Doc: A type defining the content model for a message requesting a position report .

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type defining the content model for a message requesting a position report .
 #/
record FpML5.reporting.RequestPositionReport {
  header : FpML5.reporting.RequestMessageHeader?

  # A list of validation sets the sender asserts the document is valid with respect to.
  validation : string?

  # Indicates if this message corrects an earlier request.
  isCorrection : boolean?

  # An optional identifier used to correlate between related processes
  parentCorrelationId : string?

  # A qualified identifier used to correlate between messages
  correlationId : string?

  # A numeric value that can be used to order messages with the same correlation identifier from the same sender.
  sequenceNumber : int( 1, * )?

  # Indicates which party (or parties) (and accounts) a trade or event is being processed for. Normally there will only be a maximum of 2 parties, but in the case of a novation there could be a transferor, transferee, remaining party, and other remaining party. Also, in the context of a trade package there could be several parties for which limit check is requested, necessitating multiple onBehalfOf elements. Except for these cases, there should be no more than two onBehalfOf references in a message.
  onBehalfOf : FpML5.reporting.OnBehalfOf?

  # The date for which this request desires positions and valuations.
  asOfDate : date?

  # The name of the data set (portfolio, product type, etc.) that this request corresponds to. Describes the desired report.
  dataSetName : string

  # The specific positions that this request corresponds to. Describes the desired report.
  requestedPositions : FpML5.reporting.RequestedPositions

  # The specific characteristics that should be provided.
  reportContents : FpML5.reporting.ReportContents

  # Parties can perform multiple roles in a trade lifecycle. For example, the principal parties obligated to make payments from time to time during the term of the trade, but may include other parties involved in, or incidental to, the trade, such as parties acting in the role of novation transferor/transferee, broker, calculation agent, etc. In FpML roles are defined in multiple places within a document.
  party : FpML5.reporting.Party?

  # Optional account information used to precisely define the origination and destination of financial instruments.
  account : FpML5.reporting.Account?

  fpmlVersion : string

  expectedBuild : int( 1, * )?

  actualBuild : int( 1, * )?

}

validation.Doc: A list of validation sets the sender asserts the document is valid with respect to.
validation.Name: validation

isCorrection.Doc: Indicates if this message corrects an earlier request.
isCorrection.Name: isCorrection

parentCorrelationId.Doc: An optional identifier used to correlate between related processes

Normally there will only be a maximum of 2 parties, but in the case of a novation there could be a transferor, transferee, remaining party, and other remaining party. Also, in the context of a trade package there could be several parties for which limit check is requested, necessitating multiple onBehalfOf elements. Except for these cases, there should be no more than two onBehalfOf references in a message.
onBehalfOf.Name: onBehalfOf

asOfDate.Name: asOfDate

dataSetName.Name: dataSetName

reportContents.Doc: The specific characteristics that should be provided.
reportContents.Name: reportContents

party.Doc: Parties can perform multiple roles in a trade lifecycle. For example, the principal parties obligated to make payments from time to time during the term of the trade, but may include other parties involved in, or incidental to, the trade, such as parties acting in the role of novation transferor/transferee, broker, calculation agent, etc. In FpML roles are defined in multiple places within a document.
party.Name: party

account.Name: account
